website_summaries.verdict: A thinner sole than most Dr. Martens gives these a distinct style.
pros: The waffle-pattern sole provides good grip, and the leather uppers provide protection from the elements
Shaft measures 6.5 inches from the arch, and the heel is 1 inch high
cons: Little support or padding can make these boots on the stiff side

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and poorly made
customer_reviews.text: Well, I’ve had the boots for less than six months and the boot is separating from the sole on my right foot near my pinky toe. Pretty dissatisfied since I work as a bartender and I end up with my socks soaked on my right foot. I’d read really good reviews only to find that they were falling apart after 2 months
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Murray

customer_reviews.title: NOT Docs
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to have a boot that was a bit less bulky than my 1460. I thought these were cool when I saw the on their site, so I ordered a pair here. I cannot tell you the colossal disappointment I had when I first picked them up. They feel so cheap in the hand the leather is super thin, and they just give you vibe of being some kind of Chinese knock off. The tongue refused to stay straight on both shoes. Everyone knows you have to break in docs. But these just suck. No comfort. If anyone is interested, they’re Made in China. Sold and shipped from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: OGSERB

customer_reviews.title: if you are a half size...good luck guessing if you should buy up or down
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear a mens US 10.5 and sometimes an 11....I bought a US 10 and US 11 since there are no half sizes. The 10 were definitely too small and the 11 slightly big but easily compensated with thick socks or sole inserts. according to the size chart and measurement directions i should have easily fit into the mens US 10....ouch! The 11s needed no break-in and are as close as you will ever get to having on tennis shoes. Love the supple oiled leather feel for casual wear. Sent the 10s back for refund...AMAZON was very quick with the refund
customer_reviews.author: zone6

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last three months before ripping
customer_reviews.text: After breaking them in over a period of about two weeks, these boots felt great at work, even for long shifts as a barista. Unfortunately, they did not last three months before the leather began to rip from the sole near the ball of my foot, even after applying Dr. Martens balm every few weeks from the beginning. I am very disappointed after reading many reviews about the years other people have had wearing the same pair of Dr. Martens.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great casual boots
customer_reviews.text: I live in a climate that requires boots for about 8 months of the year (half of it with snow). These are perfect for the spring/fall time as they keep me warm and dry without looking too grotesque. One thing to note is that the sole is rather low and not as chunky as the classic air-wave ones. This means, you'll need thicker socks if walking on snow as you'll lose some heat through the thinner sole. What I love: clean look. low soles What I don't care about: fizzy yellow stitching (classic Martens). not breathable.
customer_reviews.author: MARYMARY

customer_reviews.title: favorite shoe
customer_reviews.text: great shoe. tough. after break-in period they rule. I would recommend not drinking too much, hopping walls and walking home in the middle of the night to break yours in like I did though. enjoy taking an extra few minutes to get your shoes in and off though.
customer_reviews.author: butttoucher

customer_reviews.title: Simple Design, Quality Still to Be Tested.
customer_reviews.text: These are my first pair of Doc Martins. I bought them hoping for weather resistance and maybe something for the cold. So far, they look great and fit pretty good. But to some of the other reviews they are lacking in cushioning and insulation. These are pretty bare minimum when it come sto materials. So far, they've been holding up to daily wear. Don't think these are made to last heavy milage or working conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Dan V.

customer_reviews.title: I’m usually a 10.5, I got a 10 n they’re perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I got them for a motorcycle class but now I’m going to end up wearing them pretty much everyday.
customer_reviews.author: AverageJoe

customer_reviews.title: Not the old Doc Martens
customer_reviews.text: I love Doc Martens, but their newer shoes just don't live up to expectations. It seems that every year the quality and comfort decline, but the price certainly doesn't. These shoes are okay, and I don't regret buying them, but they are less than I'd hoped for. The last pair I of Doc's I truly loved were discontinued, and I don't know what they were called as they were sold at Ross's without a box for a mere $35! They were kind of like sneakers but were thick and comfy and durable. Much better than these and the Coverse imitations that Doc Makes. Thank God I've still got my old Made In England Doc boots, still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Aron Rush

customer_reviews.title: Zero drop and no arch is a good thing
customer_reviews.text: I have completely flat feet and back problems so any arch support or any heel to toe drop are not okay for me. These shoes are perfectly flat and have little to no drop. I am very thankful I found them. This is my fifth pair of Doc Martins in a few years. They are not exceptionally durrable but usually last for at least 6-8 months of daily use and walking.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Simons

customer_reviews.title: So far so good! I'll update if they fall apart.
customer_reviews.text: They look nice, fit well, pretty durable (so far). I've had them since early October. I've been wearing them to work (office job, business casual), and I've worn them hiking, working in the shop, etc. I really like that they're not insulated. I run hot and most boots of this look tend to make feet sweat. With these I'm much more comfortable as I can pick the sock I need for the temp.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus ML

customer_reviews.title: and dirty. I ordered a NEW pair of boots
customer_reviews.text: When I received these boots they had been worn, were scuffed, and dirty. I ordered a NEW pair of boots. Completely unacceptable and lazy quality control trying to pass off somebody else's returned boots as new.
customer_reviews.author: NickB

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, lightweight, durable zero-drop boots
customer_reviews.text: These are great boots. I walk between 10,000 - 17,000 steps a day in these boots. I've had them for a little over two months and they still look new. The leather is soft and the shoes are very comfortable and provide great ankle support. These are zero-drop shoes so they are awesome for my plantar fasciatis. These are not waterproof so I treated them with mink oil and it worked great. I highly recommend these boots!
customer_reviews.author: Pete & Jo

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots...
customer_reviews.text: Something different from DM's, bought it through Amazon. Reminds me of a leather Hi-Top sneakers. Give it three stripes on the side its Adidas or Converse boxing shoes. Quality of the leather on the Tobias is right up there and soft too. I think these shoes are intended 1) for walking 2) work (like inside) or 3) just a fashion statement shoe. Not for construction work. Still, I recommend it to the three types of buyers above.
customer_reviews.author: Fresh Water Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: The color and size were just like I expected and they are very comfortable. Be prepared for a little trouble putting on and taking off, there are more laces than in other boots, for me it’s necessary to loosen the laces nearly to the bottom row to be able to get the room needed. That’s really not a complaint just an observation. I have gotten many compliments on these and I wear them almost everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Schmidt happens

customer_reviews.title: Super Well Made
customer_reviews.text: Super difficult to get on and off and it of the box hit that’s to be expected! The leather is so thick and high quality that it takes some serious “breaking in” to get it to that comfortable place, be warned. But put in the time and you will not be disappointed. They open up and smooth out leaving you with a boot you’ll want to wear everyday!!
customer_reviews.author: kingpin

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Upon receiving the shoes I checked the soles since a few pictures here show them separating. Sure enough, the right shoe, near the pinky toe area was already showing some separation from the sole. This was without wearing them. I returned them and do not plan on re-ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Name brand means nothing anymore. Sad.
customer_reviews.text: Decent shoe. Runs big. The insoles provide should make a company like doc martens sick. I don’t understand how you spend good money on a shoe from a company that’s known for quality and comfort. This insoles where no thicker then a few sheets of construction paper with almost zero cusion or support. Simply sad and definitely not worth supporting this company anymore unless they reach out and correct the disappointment
customer_reviews.author: Animal

customer_reviews.title: Great, light weight, somewhat minimalist boot
customer_reviews.text: I was suspicious about the zero drop claims. I exclusively wear zero drop minimalist shoe work but wanted a more fashionable boat for the winter. Though these aren’t necessarily minimalist footwear they are very light and indeed zero drop. After a couple weeks of breaking them in and very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Greg H.

customer_reviews.title: I love these boots.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the way these look and feel. they're like combat boots....for fashion school. They're comfy and keep my feet cozy. Ive gotten plenty of compliments on them. Ive only had them for a little over a week. the pictures posted are of them without any cleaning or anything, ive only really tied them 3 or 4 times. they're my new "hop in & go" boots. I have nothing bad to say about these guys.......except they get dusty fairly easily. but thats not really a complaint against the product. its more of a jab at the owner (me) to not be lazy and just give his boots a quick wipe down. if you're thinking about buying these.....Buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Bell

customer_reviews.title: Stifffff
customer_reviews.text: I have another pair of docs like these lace up but in canvas. I was hoping the leather would be more suited for snow. But they are super stiff. :( not sure if they would break in so I'm going to send them back. The canvas ones are so comfortable so I was hoping for the same. Super bummed.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer  Janssen

customer_reviews.title: Great looking boots but the heel feels lower than the toes and they are narrow
customer_reviews.text: I really like the looks of these boots. But, they aren't that comfortable. The heel feels like it's lower than the toe of the boot. I bought some heel inserts to try and make the boot feel more level inside, but that didn't help with the fact that the boots already feel narrow inside and I have a wider foot. I can't recommend these boots as a blind buy. I'd try them on first.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Templar

customer_reviews.title: Nice boot - fit is off
customer_reviews.text: Never had much luck with Euro sizes Boot is nice. Wish it worked Style +, Material +, Laces +, Sole + I'm a solid US 10.5 M mens Tried the 43 and the 44 43 was too tight 44 was too loose Both were very loose in the heel.
customer_reviews.author: S.H.

customer_reviews.title: De.Martens are the best!!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome. They fit awesome and they look killer! No complaints whatsoever. They do run big so if you’re someone who wears a 10.1/2 in shoes you’re good just going with a 10 in doc Martens. No problems with the seller and they got here super quick.
customer_reviews.author: bryan fonseca

customer_reviews.title: Must Have
customer_reviews.text: These are best pair of shoes I’ve ever owned! They broke in quick, I can wear them nonstop and my feet never get sore, they’re top notch quality, and I’m in love with the look. I dress up and down in these. I polish them up with a suit, and I stomp around in them off road. They’re perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Sole stitching is coming apart after less than a month of light use
customer_reviews.text: I'm 165lbs and watching the sole stitching break and come loose on the left shoe. Missed my Prime return window, but honestly these shoes are pretty disappointing. Not sure if reaching out to Dr. Martens customer support will help. I just don't want the shoes to become unusable after such a short wear period. Otherwise, the leather is thin and they do make me feel pretty nimble. Best worn with cushiony socks, if your feet aren't too naturally padded. Take preferred sock thickness into consideration when sizing the shoe for yourself. Also, needed to order a full size down from normal street shoes. I have normal arches, and medium-width feet.
customer_reviews.author: ralph

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought them because I have a pair of Dr martens that are 15 years old. THEY ARE AWESOME.. these not so much, like wearing a uncomfortable foot cover rather than a shoe... I did not return. I still have in a box in the garage in hope to try them again sometime.. Might just be me ?? dunno.
customer_reviews.author: DKH559

customer_reviews.title: So far they are very comfortable. Roomy but a little snug in some areas ...
customer_reviews.text: I have only had them for a week or so. I have worn them a few hours each day to break them in. So far they are very comfortable. Roomy but a little snug in some areas which from past experience with Docs will stretch a bit as they break in. These have a flatter sole than Docs I've had in the past but for now are still quite comfortable. There is probably room for an insole if you would need it. Quality seems equal to other docs I've had.
customer_reviews.author: Craig H

customer_reviews.title: so the boot is super flexible and if you put the middle of your ...
customer_reviews.text: I guess these are meant mostly for looks, the insole they come with is just flat and thin, it doesn't provide any cushion at all. And unlike just about any other boot, these don't have a metal shank in the arch area of the sole, so the boot is super flexible and if you put the middle of your foot down on a right angle like a stair or curb, the boot will just fold over it. I bought these to work in while I'm in the garage or shop and I can't use them all day, my feet are killing me after just a couple of hours.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Really nice looking boots that fit good and are really comfortable once you brake them in. The downside is they already have cracks in the leather and have already broken through in some parts. Very disappointed with the quality. I expected a lot more from doc martens.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Right away after you put these on you realize how light and comfortable they are, almost like slippers. They did take a couple weeks to actually truly break in and get rid of the stiffness but are worth it and are amongst my favorite shoes.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good zero-drop show with more sole than vivabarefoot.
customer_reviews.text: This is not a barefoot shoe, but if you want to walk with your own arch support and no elevated heel, this boot works. It also has a wide enough toe box. Good to use these in the fall and spring for me.
customer_reviews.author: TeaMan

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice, Everyday Shoes.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are very nice, everyday shoes. They don’t offer the greatest support, but they are still comfortable. I used my first pair while working in a kitchen, and they lasted for a great amount of time. These shoes are not totally non-slip, but they are quite stable towards the beginning of the tread life. I’m now on my second pair of these because I loved them so much. Definitely worth purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Haywood

customer_reviews.title: Double Check Your Size
customer_reviews.text: Never really worn a lot of boots. So based off of reviews I went down 2 sizes for this boot. Fits like a glove. Excellent support, they look super nice, I regularly receive compliments on these. Just make sure you check the sizing charts!
customer_reviews.author: Levi K Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Fit Good. Sole getting thin the middle. Not like OG DMs
customer_reviews.text: The sole is wearing thin after daily use for 10 months. These soles are not the same as original DMs. They are much thinner. I am not too happy with the laces. They seems to curl and don't lay flat. The leather at the toes gets scuffed pretty easy. I work in an office environment and I am not that hard on these boots, but they are pretty worn for what I consider a short amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Marler

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: yes for me!! true to my size. I wear a 8 mens us in converse. so i got the 8 in us mens in these docs. they feel great as soon as i put them on. no breaking in needed. would recommend and buy again
customer_reviews.author: i buy things

customer_reviews.title: Herman Munster’s Boots
customer_reviews.text: Husband hated boot. He said it felt weirdly unlike any footwear he’s ever worn (he’s 58 btw) - clunky and uncomfortable. Said they made him feel like Herman Munster lol. We returned them. As always, Amazon was AMA-zing to dal with. Love my Prime account!
customer_reviews.author: Lola NJ

customer_reviews.title: Might fall apart
customer_reviews.text: Well after about 3 1/2 months the side of the right shoe started to come apart. I contacted dr martens warrenty department and they say that it can take anywhere from 4-6 weeks to get them replaced. Seeing as these are my work shoes i have to buy shoes to replace my shoes while they get replaced. Kinda stupid
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Truly amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I always been a fan of dr. martens, The boots are amazing but this the 1st time I ever worn sneaker of this brand. Size and everything of it is according to the description, I am a size 13 and a fit perfectly for me. I highly Recommend this sneaker to anyone that wants to jump away from the standard shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Elijah PInto

customer_reviews.title: Ok Boot
customer_reviews.text: These boots look great but are not very comfortable. I wish they had included a loop through the tongue to keep it in place because it is always veering off to one side.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 100% not slip resistant
customer_reviews.text: 100% not slip resistant. I close the bakery at costco so I bought these thinking they were slip resistant and im slidding all over the place. Im have others dr martens in 10 and these feel almost almost a whole size bigger. Wish I would of got the 9s.
customer_reviews.author: Rene Grajeda

customer_reviews.title: Tobias is the new friend
customer_reviews.text: Long story short... I ate it off a motorcycle a while back and walking in boots with a heel still bothers my back. I couldn’t let go of the Doc’s, so I tried these out. I should’ve bought these sooner. They’re my go to boots now. I wear them for all occasions, including work(not heavy duty).. really happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Bri P.

customer_reviews.title: Very well made.
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these boots. He's use to the heavier Dr Marten boots but loves the new style and lightweight comfort. This pair is leather not vegan. Very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Allen

customer_reviews.title: I love these boots so much
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots so much. Dr martens is becoming my favorite shoe brand for it's durable quality and stylish grunge look. the shoes are a little hard to put on and off, you really have to loosen the shoe strings. That's one little con but besides that I wear them almost everyday. These kinds look really great and i have gotten compliments. I recommend getting this shoe if this kind peaks your interest.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Ly

customer_reviews.title: Good looking but uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: They look amazing but these shoes are super stiff to begin with. These shoes would take a while to break in and I need a comfy shoe from the get go
customer_reviews.author: joshua

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, looks great and takes too long to get on and off.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes look great and are comfortable as one would expect from Doc Martians. They are a major pain trying to get on and off. I have to pull the laces through the eyelets and loosen them as much as possible to get them on and off. I wish the laces slid much more easily through the eyelets.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable for boots!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are so comfortable and they fit exactly right in all the right places. I’ve never purchased Dr. Martens boots before so I thought I’d try it out and I was not disappointed. Love these so much and will be trying out other types for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality
customer_reviews.text: This was the most poorly constructed low quality item I have ever seen. Their is absolutely no arch Support completely flat cheap plastic garbage. Inside was uncomfortable as all get out .
customer_reviews.author: Terry Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband who has trouble finding a good shoe that doesn’t wear out right away. He has a collapsed arches and needs to be able to put inserts in his shoes. He says they are very comfortable and are not too heavy (he stands for work all day). Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria M.

customer_reviews.title: Stiff
customer_reviews.text: Overall good shoe, but are quite stiff and the tongue slides to the outside of your foot. Sole is not quite as rugged as other DMs. More of a fashionable choice. Works best when not completely laced up.
customer_reviews.author: Drew63

customer_reviews.title: Someone fix the tongue sliding issue and make this shoe perfect!
customer_reviews.text: While it's a great show, having no loop on the tounge makes it super annoying. I had to get cushions for the top part of the tounge to sort of hold it in place. Pending visit to get a look stiched in for the laces to help hold up the tounge.
customer_reviews.author: Kanwar

customer_reviews.title: Ya won’t be disappointed if you know the style
customer_reviews.text: Love these for taking the bike 🏍 out or going anywhere in general. Nice pair of light weight docs! They won’t disappointment if these are the style your looking for.
customer_reviews.author: M.D.Geist

customer_reviews.title: One happy buyer!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these as a Christmas gift for my Husband, he loved them! They fit him true to size & the packaging was good. Arrived on time. I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jess Andrade

customer_reviews.title: Don't breath
customer_reviews.text: The boot fits fine, very stiff leather I've had them awhile now and still haven't broke them in. They don't breath very good so if you looking for a boot that doesn't make your foot sweat this isn't it.
customer_reviews.author: Toby Tipton

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable, no support at all
customer_reviews.text: No support at all, hard cardboard like material. Feels like walking on concrete with no arch support whatsoever. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: A. Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a shoe, tough like a boot
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots. Feels like a tennis shoe but all the benefits of the weather and element ruggedness of a boot. Very comfortable fit and I love the matte style.
customer_reviews.author: Sophocles

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality
customer_reviews.text: Cheap rubber sole and bad stitching. I stepped on a staple the first day I got it and it puncture the sole with ease. A couple months later the sides started separating from the seams just like the other photos. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew A Biddle

customer_reviews.title: They are amazing for my fiancé to wear as daily shoes but ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought three pair of these boots before finding the right size. They are amazing for my fiancé to wear as daily shoes but I would recommend trying on Doc's in the store before buying online. Overall- great shoe for dressing up or down. My fiancé has worn them around town and to dress up events. They are easily dressed up or down.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: The best work boots!
customer_reviews.text: Replacements for a pair that I trashed over 4 years they were my favorite work boots and I happy to wear these for another 4 years!
customer_reviews.author: Maximus

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend, I have wore Docs for 25 years now and each pair has lasted 10-15 years I even have the 1st pair I ever bought still in great condition.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas F Spaniola

customer_reviews.title: Why I won't purchase dr. Martens again.
customer_reviews.text: The Doctor Martin iconic yellow stitching is fake like most other shoes there is no stitching except in the welt it might as well be fake stitching why is show the yellow iconic stitching if it's stitched basically to glue
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These boots are super comfortable I wear them when I ride my motorcycle and I also wear them as dress boots I definitely would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy boots for the rain - not much cushion on the interior
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my son and he loves the look. The construction of the boot is very utilitarian, no padding on the insole and a bit stiff at first. We may add a slip-in insole, but these will work great for his treks through campus in the rain and still more stylish than galoshes. The sole is not as chunky as most Dr. Martens which is a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: TheBigCheez

customer_reviews.title: Missing Tongue Stay
customer_reviews.text: I love the boots—I’ve never had a pair of Docs I didn’t like. One thing that’s missing with these is a tongue stay.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Darelle

customer_reviews.title: just like the alfie boots but leather
customer_reviews.text: i love them just put two inserts inside of them and much more comfortable. the stitching is said to come undone on sides like the alfie boots I have had, we will see but these also look great with pants or shorts so far so good thx
customer_reviews.author: C.J.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: My husband wears his shoes out like crazy and these seem to last him a little longer than some shoes. They look nice too not like the clunky doc Martens.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, fits true to size.
customer_reviews.text: Fit true to size. I tried on several Dr Martens shoes on in a store, and they seemed to run a size large. I ordered one size smaller and found out they are true to size. I returned them and ordered the right size. I like the flat sole, it's the first Dr Martens shoe I have liked.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: These were a gift for my son
customer_reviews.text: My son said they are a bit difficult to break in because he is used to athletic shoes, but overall he loves them. They really look nice and he is very happy with the choice.
customer_reviews.author: Connie D

customer_reviews.title: I would buy them again but don't need to!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely satisfied with the quality of these boots. Spent a week to loosen the leather and then they were just perfect. Spent a whole winter in Massachusetts and they still look like new!
customer_reviews.author: D Myl

customer_reviews.title: Favorite boot
customer_reviews.text: Totally love this style doc. Looks great with everything . Walk everywhere and super comfy.
customer_reviews.author: steven undzilo

customer_reviews.title: Go to a store and know what you’re getting
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only had one other pair of docs and they were a different style. These aren’t bad but feel cheep compared to those. Having a little buyers remorse but with a new insole they aren’t bad.
customer_reviews.author: The Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Good boot.
customer_reviews.text: The only problems I had with these shoes where that the wide size 4 E was not available. This show is wider than other boots but they are still snug around my metatarsals. Also with the boot was covered in a waterproof liner. Beside those 2 points they are great work boots all you need is some thick wool socks.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Vigano

customer_reviews.title: Classic Doc simplicity and style.
customer_reviews.text: Comfy, supportive, clean look, but rugged enough for daily (and all day) use.
customer_reviews.author: Mute

customer_reviews.title: A little tight in the toes
customer_reviews.text: Fits great, I could have gone up half a size but I'm anticipating wearing them in a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Good until it wasn’t
customer_reviews.text: The product worked well....and then it didn’t. I’ve only had these shoes for 7 months. And the spot where my pinky toes go have completely worn out and have come through the leather. Highly disappointed. Doc Martens should be a brand that would last a lifetime and I’ve maintaned the leather in these shoes and I haven’t lasted a year.
customer_reviews.author: V3nture

customer_reviews.title: Perfect boots
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my fiance for the holidays. They're a perfect fit and very nice quality. The tongue slides more on one shoe than the other but it's nothing detrimental.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Takes about 6 months to get holes in these boots.
customer_reviews.text: My second pair lasted less than a year, I can see here that I ordered them 11 months ago. I allready had a big hole in them many months ago, so it usually takes 6 months to get a whole in them, even though im not wearing them much in summer. Canvas sneakers last longer, but im almost about to buy the third pair because I like them until the hole appears and the rain is reaching my socks. The first pair didnt last any longer.
customer_reviews.author: Mattias

customer_reviews.title: Minimalist boot.
customer_reviews.text: I am loving the comfort of the complete flatness of the sole. I don't think that I will need expensive orthotics any more
customer_reviews.author: RetiredGp

customer_reviews.title: Good for short distance casual walking
customer_reviews.text: For distant walking at rapid pace, this shoe has no padding to feet when walking on hard surfaces(like tile) walked last Monday, and got large blisters on both feet.
customer_reviews.author: Harry K. Bonfield Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Best boots I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: 2 days and I'm in love, these have got to be my new favorite shoes, definitely will buy again, they didn't take to long to break in and now they are perfect
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: I bought these looking for a minimalist boot and I feel like I got that and then some.
customer_reviews.text: Doc Martin schooled converse on how to do "minimal". Love my boots.
customer_reviews.author: Lily Lundy

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I have a slightly wide foot, and they were just barely wider. Solid leather body means for a tough shoe, but also requires that they be broken in. Overall, I'm very happy with this purchase. Now if only they'd start making them in England again. What can you do?
customer_reviews.author: The Lord Gold

customer_reviews.title: Can't Go Wrong with Dr. Marten
customer_reviews.text: Classic Dr. Marten boot that literally withstands all elements and retains that grungy/hipster look.
customer_reviews.author: D.R.

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, light weight, steezy af. 10\10 will buy again
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through 4 pairs of these...at least. Not because they are poor quality, because they are super versatile and i put them through all sorts of abuse. They are somewhat dressy so i can wear them in the office and kinda like a boot so they're appropriate for the more hands on aspects of my job. I ride a skateboard into work, they are light enough and have enough flexibility to do that comfortably. Frikken love these.
customer_reviews.author: thegreenwomb

customer_reviews.title: Boots with blast!
customer_reviews.text: I received these via the Amazon locker system & was pleased with the product packaging as well as the cool way the red locker just popped open when I entered the code! At home,I found that the sleek design of this boot fit my foot well.They are comfortable almost like a sneaker.With jeans I find that they give a somewhat "post-apocalyptic"fashion style I like.These boots are great & I look forward to buying a second pair in grey.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: These boots look great, broke in quickly
customer_reviews.text: These boots look great,they broke in quickly, and are quite comfortable. They fit as expected. They slip on wet floors and I bought them for work so this sucks. Additionally I think the right boot is a lemon as the tongue will not stay center ever, and the sole came away from the upper, above the stitching, after less than a week, ( few drops of super glue fixed that issue but the tongue always falling to the side is annoying). They look good and feel good. I might buy these again but not for my work. Cool cheap boots.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Dr. Martin
customer_reviews.text: Well, I have to wear these shoes pretty much everyday, and sometimes i feel like they need some arch support or an insert or something. They do a much better job of keeping my feet dry than sneakers, and seeing i work inside the sole is good enough. But I do wish for a better arch supporting foot bed. Overall pretty comfy, fit well and have broken in fairly well. Decent enough.
customer_reviews.author: crip

customer_reviews.title: fit like a size smaller
customer_reviews.text: Made in China. I made sure I ordered a US13. They were labeled a US 13 But they fit way to small, gave them to my son who wears a size 12 and they were almost too small for him
customer_reviews.author: Alan B.

customer_reviews.title: but overall I'm happy with them
customer_reviews.text: These are flat. I bought them as a minimalist boot and that is exactly what I got. They took a few days to break in, but overall I'm happy with them. They are very comfortable and hold up to the Pacific Northwest rainy winter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great looking, comfy boots
customer_reviews.text: Great looking boots. They are comfy and nice fitting. The sole is cushioned as well. Takes some time to soften cause the leather is very sturdy. Happy I got them. Almost like sneakers
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the Style and Quality
customer_reviews.text: Love the style! and quality. I wont be wearing them everyday tho as they are not the most comfortable shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Raz

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these boots. This is my second pair. The first ones are 7 years old and still fully intact, just extremely well worn.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: I love these boots
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. I have had them for 10 months so far. They lasted through the rain and snow. I don't clean them as much as I should, butt hey haven't lasted the east coast weather. They fit very well.
customer_reviews.author: Justin M.

customer_reviews.title: Buy them along with round laces
customer_reviews.text: Great boot. I like the less aggressive sole than the traditional DM. They lose a star due the flat laces provided...it takes to long to tie the things. They should have come with round laces so you could pull them tight easier.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: made in England
customer_reviews.text: These boots are exactly what I was looking for. I find these to be an excellent boot/shoe for mountain biking. They are very light compared to more traditional boots that feel heavy and clumsy. The soles grip surprisingly well.The leather is substantial enough to protect your feet far better than regular tennis shoes. the overall construction is of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots
customer_reviews.text: So far there good i bartend So my feet are constantly getting splashed on occasionally so hold up to water damage the only thing I would do is go half a size bigger next time so I can fit some insoles because they do run true to size other then that I dig them
customer_reviews.author: Jose garcia

customer_reviews.title: Not the Docs of old
customer_reviews.text: These are bonded leather coated with some thin rubbery material. Lasted a couple months and now peeling. Complete junk.
customer_reviews.author: bassgoat1979

customer_reviews.title: I bought one pair for one person who loved them and two others followed and wanted them as ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 pairs of these for people in my family. I bought one pair for one person who loved them and two others followed and wanted them as well.
customer_reviews.author: Yesenia Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Fit as expected
customer_reviews.text: I own another pair of Dr. Martens but wanted a lighter pair for riding my motorcycle. I thought they may be snug and ordered the same size anyway hoping they would stretch like my other pair. They seem to be stretching and I am sure will fit me like a glove after using them enough times. Love the look, feel and weight!
customer_reviews.author: C. Williquette

customer_reviews.title: ... shoes might be a bit narrow but nope it’s great. And I wear a size 14 and have ...
customer_reviews.text: Thought these shoes might be a bit narrow but nope it’s great. And I wear a size 14 and have a wide foot. I heard about Dr martens for years and people were right.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Swag

product_meta.title: Dr. Martens Men's Tobias Boot
product_meta.description:
The tobias features a sleek silhouette chalk full of doc's iconic dna in a lighter contemporary style

Easy, casual and perfectly classic, Dr. Martens reinvents a favorite with the Tobias boot. In fabric, this understated offering boasts a secure lace-up closure and the classic contrast-stitched Doc Marten midsole for tons of appeal. A grippy sole grants you safe passage wherever you take yourself in Tobias.

Dr. Martens is the stuff of legends. It all began near Munich, Germany in 1945 when Dr. Klaus Maertens injured his foot in a skiing accident in the Bavarian Alps. To make walking easier during the healing process, he designed a shoe with an air-cushioned sole. Using old rubber tires, he constructed soles that had air trapped within closed compartments. He showed his prototype to his engineer/inventor friend, Dr. Herbert Funck, and together they decided to develop and produce the shoes. Not only did the shoe solve the doctor's immediate problem, but it also started to sell well in Germany. By 1959 the two decided that they needed a company to produce and distribute the shoes, then called Dr. Maertens, in other parts of the world. At first, many manufacturers rejected the concept of an air cushioned sole as a short-lived gimmick. However, the R. Griggs Group, located in the village of Wollaston in England, decided to go along with the idea by creating the first work boot with the revolutionary sole. On the first of April 1960, the first cherry red eight-eyelet work boot was produced and named 1460. To sell the brand name better in England, the name was anglicized to Dr. Martens. The range was branded AirWair and the rest is history.

See more
feature_bullets: Comfortable airwair sole. Care Instructions: [Greasy] = Wipe clean with a damp cloth only, do not use leather cleaner, this may dull or damage the finish.
Puritan stitch detail and yellow welt stitching
Greasy lamper leather for a lightweight, soft and giving look and feel
